You can also cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.KrM3oHVv13RAALrS]{Find Traps} (2 charges) and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.GtGjNjPBgUHxGYAD]{Sending} (3 charges) from it.

Spirit Ward (Very Rare+). When you fail a saving throw against the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ej6wyY4G1gOcb1U6]{Magic Jar} spell or possession (such as by a ghost), you can expend 3 charges to succeed instead.

Third Eye Opened (Legendary). The planchette now has 13 charges and regains [[/r 1d12 + 1]] expended charges daily at dusk. You can also cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XqzXSKNR75ZdYTA9]{Divination} (4 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.dSTu1MaPhBqPITwM]{Contact Other Plane} (5 charges), and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsterfeatures.Item.rDoNJnKdY47x8MD4]{Etherealness} (7 charges) from it.

Xeet8gmdbdgu6RRP.name: Tooth of the Jinxed Leviathan Xeet8gmdbdgu6RRP
Xeet8gmdbdgu6RRP.description:
Weapon (dagger), rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This tooth is razor sharp and can be wielded as a dagger. Its “hilt” is wrapped in alligator hide, and the flat of its blade flickers with magenta hex magic in carved glyphs.

You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by its rarity. While holding the tooth, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your spells, and you can use the following properties.

Jinx of Dire Fortune (Rare+). As a bonus action, you can force one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the tooth’s bonus). On a failed save, the target is jinxed for 1 minute. While jinxed, when the target makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw and rolls an even number on the d20, it must reroll the d20 and take the new roll. On a successful save, you must make the same saving throw, becoming jinxed for 1 minute on a failure. You can’t use this property while another creature is jinxed by it.

Exposed Weak Spot (Very Rare+). When you make an attack roll with the tooth, you score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.

Steal Unluck (Very Rare+). When an enemy you can see within 60 feet of you makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw with advantage, you can use your reaction to negate their advantage. Once this property has been used, it can’t be used again until a creature you can see rolls a 1 on a d20, or until the next dusk.

Strange Fortunes (Legendary). Each time you score a critical hit with the tooth against an enemy, the tooth gains a cumulative +3 bonus to damage rolls. This bonus is in addition to the bonus based on the tooth’s rarity. When you roll a 1 on the d20 for an attack roll with the tooth, you take force damage equal to the accumulated bonus. This property’s damage bonus returns to +0 when you finish a long rest.

Jinx of Dire Fortune (Rare+).name: Jinx of Dire Fortune (Rare+)
Jinx of Dire Fortune (Rare+).description: While jinxed, when the target makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw and rolls an even number on the d20, it must reroll the d20 and take the new roll. On a successful save, you must make the same saving throw, becoming jinxed for 1 minute on a failure. You can’t use this property while another creature is jinxed by it.

YSwHE4AdiHvITluu.name: Hide of the Brimstone Behemoth YSwHE4AdiHvITluu
YSwHE4AdiHvITluu.description:
Wondrous item, rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This cloak was made from the hide of a reptilian magma Fiend, incomparable in its destructive power. Flame now shies away from it, for one who has mastered such a titanic creature can master its element.

While wearing this cloak, you gain a bonus to Armor Class and Constitution saving throws determined by the cloak’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Deep-Dweller (Rare+). You have resistance to &reference[fire apply=false] damage and a burrowing speed equal to your walking speed. Once during your turn when you emerge from burrowing, each creature within 10 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 16 + the hide’s bonus), taking [[/damage 2d8 fire]] damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Infernal Roar (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XXUDGFELgoskdOD0]{Fear} (save DC = 16 + the hide’s bonus) from the cloak. This property can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

Hellfire Maw (Very Rare+). As an action, you can exhale hellfire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 16 + the hide’s bonus). On a failed save, a creature takes [[/damage 4d6 fire]] damage and [[/damage 4d6 necrotic]] damage, and it can’t regain hit points for 1 minute. On a successful save, it takes half damage only. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Pernicious Fire Immunity (Legendary). Fire actively avoids you. You have immunity to &reference[fire apply=false] damage. When you are the target of an attack that deals fire damage, the attack randomly targets another creature within the attack’s range, which can include the attacker. When you make a saving throw against an effect that deals fire damage, you must choose one other creature that is also making the saving throw against that effect. It has disadvantage on the save.

Nightwatcher Potion.name: Nightwatcher Potion
Nightwatcher Potion.description:
Potion, Rare

When you drink this potion, you have Darkvision out to 120 feet for the next 24 hours. During that time, you don’t need to sleep, and if you take a Long Rest, you can remain conscious throughout.

This clay bottle with a waxed stopper is painted with the head of a great horned owl, and the liquid within is midnight blue

Heightened Potency. The duration increases to 72 hours.

ZYIa4IhluSCVJVYJ.name: Green Ribbon ZYIa4IhluSCVJVYJ
ZYIa4IhluSCVJVYJ.description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

This green satin ribbon is just long enough to fasten around a person’s neck comfortably. It’s hard to think why you’d even want to remove it. While you wear the ribbon, you have a +5 bonus to death saving throws, and it grants the following properties.

Instant Attunement. If the ribbon is wrapped around the neck of a dead creature that has been dead no longer than 10 days and wasn’t Undead when it died, the creature returns to life as if by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.AGFMPAmuzwWO6Dfz]{Raise Dead} spell, and it instantly attunes to the ribbon. The creature dies immediately if its attunement to the ribbon ends or if the ribbon is removed.

Ribbon’s Mending. When you drop to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to immediately regain hit points equal to half your level (minimum 1). Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk or until you roll a 20 on the d20 for a death saving throw.

Curse of the Ribbon. Creatures other than you within 60 feet of you have a −1 penalty to death saving throws. This penalty increases by 1 each time you use the Ribbon’s Mending property.

Whistle of the Vagrant.name: Whistle of the Vagrant
Whistle of the Vagrant.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

This tarnished brass whistle belonged to the conductor of the Ghostlight Express, imbuing it with ghastly, mysterious powers. Its metal is cold to the touch, and its sound is an unnerving shriek.

While you hold or wear the whistle, you gain a bonus determined by the whistle’s rarity to all saving throws, and you can use the following properties.

Call the Dead (Rare+). As a Magic action, you can blow the whistle to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.n4JDcFKe5ikzYmAc]{Gentle Repose} on all dead bodies within 30 feet of you. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Sense the Undead (Rare+). As a Bonus Action, you can detect the presence and location of Undead within 60 feet of you, even through Total Cover of any material other than iron or lead.

Undaunted (Rare+). You have Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the &reference[Frightened apply=false] condition.

Call the Undead (Very Rare+). As a Magic action, you can blow the whistle to cast Banishment against an Undead creature (save DC = 16 + the whistle’s bonus) from it. The target always appears in a harmless demiplane resembling the interior of a train. If you maintain the spell for its full duration, the target arrives in an appropriate afterlife. Creatures with Legendary Actions automatically succeed on the saving throw. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Steam Cloud (Very Rare+). You can blow the whistle to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.IBJmWjzbQGu7M4UX]{Fog Cloud} (no Concentration required) from it. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Touched by Death (Very Rare+). You have Resistance to &reference[Necrotic apply=false] damage.

Afterlife Express (Legendary). You can blow the whistle to cast @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.7pDfvlcuyckcIBJE]{Ghastly Charge}* (takes the form of a ghost train) from it. This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

Withered Hand.name: Withered Hand
Withered Hand.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

The skin of this desiccated hand on a looped leather cord is covered with tattoos signifying dreadful hexes. The fingers seem to curl slightly when the hand is at the edge of your vision. While you hold or wear the hand, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs. The hand grants the following properties.

Withering Grasp. When you make an Unarmed Strike, you can extend your reach to 30 feet with threads of magenta jinx magic. When you do so, on a hit, you deal Necrotic damage instead of Bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a creature no more than one size larger than you, you can give it the Grappled condition with the threads. The escape DC for this grapple can use your spellcasting ability or Charisma (your choice) in place of your Strength. The Grappled condition ends if you use this property against a different target.

Withering Curse. When you use the Withering Grasp property, your Hit Point maximum decreases by 1. Your Hit Point maximum can’t decrease again until you finish a Long Rest. You don’t regain the Hit Point maximum lost to this curse when you finish a Long Rest.

Crown of the Barrow King.name: Crown of the Barrow King
Crown of the Barrow King.description:
Wondrous item, rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This crown of twisted iron has five sharp, tall spikes that are crusted with dried blood. None who see it doubt the malice and corruption that the Barrow King imbued into it.

While you wear the crown, you gain a bonus determined by the crown’s rarity to spell attack rolls and to your spell save DC for necromancy spells and spells that deal necrotic damage, and you can use the following properties.

Demand of the Dead (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.I2LUSF5ogc7Bj62e]{Speak with Dead} from the crown.

Grave Grasp (Rare+). You know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.vrN18tbTw7io5MWd]{Chill Touch} cantrip. Your spell attack bonus with it is +9 (rare), +10 (very rare), or +11 (legendary).

Necromancer’s Call (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.oyE5nVppa5mde5gT]{Animate Dead} from the crown. It can be used to cast this spell three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

Master of Undeath (Very Rare+). Undead that you create or summon have twice as many hit points as normal and have advantage on saving throws.

Soul Transfer (Very Rare+). When you drop to 0 hit points or fail a death saving throw, you can transfer your soul into an Undead that you created and that is within 1 mile of you (no action required). Your previous body dies instantly. Your new body has none of your possessions except the crown. You use your game statistics, except the target Undead’s current hit points replace your current hit points. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Compel Undead (Legendary). As an action, you can choose an Undead within 30 feet of you. It must succeed on a [[/save WIS DC 19]] saving throw or be &reference[charmed apply=false] for 1 minute. It obeys your commands while charmed in this way, and the charmed condition ends early when the creature has half its hit points or fewer.

bZSQ7TmlvcGOMyZf.name: Bloody Fiddle bZSQ7TmlvcGOMyZf
bZSQ7TmlvcGOMyZf.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

This scarlet-lacquered fiddle is warm to the touch, like the heat of fresh blood. Though it looks like it has seen better days, its sound is clear and strong.

While you hold the fiddle, you gain a +2 bonus to Charisma (Performance) checks, and you can use the following properties.

Song of Stirred Blood. As a Magic action, you can play a lively or stirring tune on the fiddle. Up to six creatures of your choice within 30 feet of you gain Temporary Hit Points equal to [[/r 1d10]] + your Proficiency Bonus, and if you have Bardic Inspiration dice, you can expend and roll one to add it to the total. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Sanguine Curse. The first time that you play the fiddle after finishing a Long Rest, you take [[/damage 1 Slashing]] damage that ignores Resistance. When you use the Song of Stirred Blood property, this Slashing damage increases by 1.

Sanguine Curse.name: Sanguine Curse
Sanguine Curse.description: Damage increases by 1 each time you use song of stirred blood.

Visage of the Old Ways.name: Visage of the Old Ways
Visage of the Old Ways.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (+2), Very Rare (+4), Legendary (+6) (Requires Attunement)

This wood-carved mask has a haunted expression and makes the wearer’s eyes look like empty shadows. Rabbit ears protrude over the head. While you wear the mask, you hear the whispers of an ancient forest archfey deep within your mind.

While wearing the mask, you gain a bonus to your damage rolls when you deal Fire damage determined by the mask’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Cultic Mask (Rare+). You can’t be targeted by Divination spells or perceived through scrying sensors. Ability checks made to discern your identity have a minimum DC of 25.

Fire Within (Rare+). While you are burning, your weapon attacks deal an extra [[/damage 2d4 Fire]] damage. You can take a Bonus Action to begin or stop burning.

Strange Sight (Rare+). You have Darkvision with a range of 60 feet, and you can see normally through areas obscured by smoke.

Mastery of Flame (Very Rare+). Fire damage you deal ignores Resistance.

Sacrificial Flame (Very Rare+). As a Bonus Action, you can cause a creature you can see with 0 Hit Points that is within 30 feet of you to burst into flame. Its body burns to ash over the next minute, and when a creature Hostile to you starts its turn in a 10-foot Emanation originating from the body, it takes [[/damage 2d8 Fire]] damage. The flame is extinguished if the target regains any Hit Points.

Harvest Offering (Legendary). As a Magic action, you can expend up to 5 Hit Point Dice to regain a spell slot of a level equal to the number of Hit Dice spent. Alternatively, you can touch a creature that is willing or that has the Unconscious condition and force them to expend any number of these Hit Dice in your place. This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

e1hocfTMHnGwFipv.name: Chunk of Oozing Fungus e1hocfTMHnGwFipv
e1hocfTMHnGwFipv.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

This fist-sized fungal growth is a pallid color, is oozy and lumpy, and frequently fills the air with spores. The fungus has the following properties.

Spore Cloud. As a Magic action, you can throw the fungus up to 30 feet. The fungus is destroyed and explodes into a cloud of spores in a 30-foot Sphere centered on that point. Each creature other than you in the area must make a [[/save CON DC 14]] saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes [[/damage 3d8 Poison]] damage and has the &reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of your next turn. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more also has the Incapacitated condition. On a successful save, a target takes half damage only.

Regrow. You can grow another Chunk of Oozing Fungus by coughing green-black spores into your hand as a Bonus Action. When you do so, you must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or your Hit Point maximum decreases by 5.

Fungal Curse. You have a −1 penalty to Constitution saving throws. This penalty increases by 1 immediately after you succeed or fail on the saving throw from the Regrow property.

eWogY6SdFqMNeKeD.name: Nectar of the Green Man eWogY6SdFqMNeKeD
eWogY6SdFqMNeKeD.description:
Potion, very rare

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.dp6xny4v8PDoIGjh]{Commune with Nature} spell, but your experience is filled with terror and dread. You must make a [[/save WIS DC 15]] saving throw. On a failure, for the next 8 hours, you have disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks while you can see a forest. You automatically succeed on the save if you are immune to being frightened.

This bottle is carved from wood, with a green, leafy face adorning its surface. The liquid is a deep green streaked with shades of umber.

Heightened Potency. You can learn all five facts from @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.dp6xny4v8PDoIGjh]{Commune with Nature}.

ek9SRS94Bd497y44.name: Hook of the Tall Man ek9SRS94Bd497y44
ek9SRS94Bd497y44.description:
Weapon (war pick), rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This hook is made from a single huge claw attached to a large bleached fingerbone mounted on a haft of ash. The tip of the claw gives off an eerie glow. The finger and claw were cut from the hand of the Tall Man.

You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon determined by the hook’s rarity. While holding the hook, you can use the following properties.

Snare (Rare+). When you hit a creature with the hook, you can force it to make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 8 plus your proficiency bonus and the ability modifier used to make the attack roll. On a failed save, the creature is knocked prone.

Fey Haunt’s Stride (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.wqfAVANuQonNBgnL]{Misty Step} from the hook, and when you do so, you have advantage on your next Dexterity (Stealth) check made before the end of your next turn. This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses when you roll initiative.

Strike from Shadows (Very Rare+). If you are hidden or &reference[invisible apply=false] when you start your turn, you have advantage on the first attack you make on your turn against a creature that couldn’t see you, even if you are visible or noticed before you make the attack. If that attack hits, it deals an extra [[/damage 2d6 piercing]] damage.

Hunter’s Hook (Legendary). When you hit with an opportunity attack made with the hook, the target takes an extra [[/damage 2d6 psychic]] damage, and its speed is 0 until the end of the turn.

Terrifying Stride (Legendary). Immediately after you use the Fey Haunt’s Stride property, you can choose a creature within 20 feet of you. It must succeed on a [[/save WIS DC 19]] saving throw or be &reference[frightened apply=false] until the end of your next turn. While frightened in this way, the creature can’t take the &reference[Disengage apply=false] action.

ewNarZMSfQvM4CXa.name: Cauldron of the Vermintoll Coven ewNarZMSfQvM4CXa
ewNarZMSfQvM4CXa.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

The tarnished cauldron bubbles with a strange, dark liquid. Even in transport, the liquid stays within the rune-emblazoned rim of the cauldron.

While you hold the cauldron, you can use it as a Spellcasting Focus for your spells, you gain a bonus determined by the cauldron’s rarity to all saving throws, and you can use the following properties.

Size Change (Rare+). You can perform a 1-minute ritual to change the cauldron’s size from Tiny to Medium, or from Medium to Tiny. It weighs 1 lb. when Tiny and 80 lb. when Medium. As a Medium object, its feet can move. It has a Speed of 20 feet and moves when you command it during your turn (no action required).

Cookpot (Rare+). As part of a Short or Long Rest, you can use the Medium cauldron to prepare food for up to ten creatures. At the end of the rest, each creature that eats gains 2d6 Temporary Hit Points.

Vermincall (Rare+). As a Magic action, you can spill liquid from the cauldron to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.1Drt0SHxbEAHxprN]{Conjure Animals} with it. The conjured spirits take the form of grotesque insects or rats. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Fortifying Gorge (Very Rare+). When you use the Cookpot property, one creature of your choice who eats gains a +2 bonus to AC until you finish a Short or Long Rest. During this time, the creature’s skin is hardened and monstrous.

Coven Abomination (Legendary). As a Bonus Action, you can drink from the cauldron or administer a draught from it to a creature within 5 feet. For 1 hour, the drinker of the thick, sickly-sweet liquid becomes Large if it is currently smaller than that, its reach increases by 5 feet, and its melee attacks deal an extra 1d8 damage. When the effect ends, the creature has the Incapacitated condition for 1 minute from the agony of its bones shrinking slower than its flesh.

fTRn6XwNVoHTgtJd.name: Elixir of Fogwalking fTRn6XwNVoHTgtJd
fTRn6XwNVoHTgtJd.description:
Potion, rare

When you drink this potion, your breath billows out in clouds of fog. For the next 10 minutes, fog and smoke don’t hinder your vision, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.IBJmWjzbQGu7M4UX]{Fog Cloud} up to three times (no concentration required), and you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.wqfAVANuQonNBgnL]{Misty Step} up to three times as long as your teleportation begins or ends in an area of fog.

This bottle has a base like cobblestone. The glass widens near the top before narrowing again into an iron cap, resembling a lantern. The liquid inside is a murky gray.

Heightened Potency. The potion’s duration becomes 1 hour, and when you use this potion to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.wqfAVANuQonNBgnL]{Misty Step}, you also gain resistance to &reference[bludgeoning apply=false], &reference[piercing apply=false], and &reference[slashing apply=false] damage until the start of your next turn.

hXLUsntZDeWrxfNj.name: Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood hXLUsntZDeWrxfNj
hXLUsntZDeWrxfNj.description:
Staff, rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This twisted wooden staff is crowned by a trinket-adorned deer’s skull. It was fashioned by Farryn before she delved into the dark lore of Gorthos. Soft, fragrant moss and earthy mushrooms grow along the staff’s length.

While holding the staff, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your spells, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the staff’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Living Ward (Rare+). You have resistance to necrotic damage.

Servant of the Cycle (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.uUWb1wZgtMou0TVP]{Cure Wounds} (3rd-level version) from the staff. When you do so, the next time you hit with an attack before the end of your next turn, the target takes an extra [[/damage 1d10 necrotic]] damage. This property can be used three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

Cycle’s Balance (Very Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.LmRHHMtplpxr9fX6]{Revivify} from the staff. When you do so, the next time a creature fails a saving throw against a spell you cast in the next hour, it and creatures of your choice within 20 feet of it take [[/damage 4d10 necrotic]] damage. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Sacrifice of Flesh (Very Rare+). When a spell you cast restores hit points, you can take necrotic damage up to twice the level of the spell that can’t be reduced or prevented in any way. If you do so, the target regains additional hit points equal to three times the damage you take.

Death Blossom (Legendary). When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you dies, you can use your reaction to make flowers bloom around them. Creatures of your choice within 30 feet of the dead creature regain [[/damage 4d8 healing]]{4d8 hit points} and gain [[/damage 2d8 temp]]. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood +2.name: Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood +2

Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood +3.name: Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood +3
Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood +3

Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood +2.name: Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood +2

Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood +1.name: Staff of Farryn of the Greenwood +1

hddM5hGJP4JKITbc.name: Nightwatcher Potion hddM5hGJP4JKITbc
hddM5hGJP4JKITbc.description:
Potion, rare

When you drink this potion, you have darkvision out to 120 feet for the next 24 hours. During that time, you don’t need to sleep, and if you take a long rest, you can remain conscious throughout.

This clay bottle with a waxed stopper is painted with the head of a great horned owl, and the liquid within is midnight blue

Heightened Potency. The duration increases to 72 hours.

isuJX7VSaBWbgWTN.name: Reaper’s Revenge isuJX7VSaBWbgWTN
isuJX7VSaBWbgWTN.description:
Potion, Rare

When you drink this potion, you are filled with intense and violent vigor, gaining 3d8 Temporary Hit Points. For 1 minute, when one of your enemies dies within 30 feet of you, you can take a Reaction to regain [[/damage 1d8 Healing]]{1d8 Hit Points}.

The base of this glass potion bottle is shaped like a skull, and the images of scythes run up its neck.

Heightened Potency. For 1 minute after drinking this potion, when you hit a Bloodied creature with an attack roll and deal damage to it, the creature takes an extra [[/damage 1d8 Necrotic]] damage.

jh5735cwzBpJkdPp.name: Toy Riverboat jh5735cwzBpJkdPp
jh5735cwzBpJkdPp.description:
Wondrous Item, Very Rare (Requires Attunement)

This tiny, brightly painted boat is made in exacting detail, with smokestacks and a paddlewheel that turns, but it looks like a child’s plaything. Studying it reveals a miniscule but unearthly passenger within the boat’s cabin. The riverboat grants the following properties.

Passengers. As a Magic action, you and up to twelve other willing, Medium or smaller creatures you can see within 30 feet of yourself shrink to Tiny size and appear aboard the riverboat, along with up to 300 pounds of gear per passenger. The boat moves over water or other liquids at 3 miles per hour and doesn’t require wind. You can travel this way for up to 12 hours a day. A passenger that leaves the boat returns to its normal size.

Unearthly Passenger. You can release the riverboat onto water to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ImlCJQwR1VL40Qem]{Arcane Eye} with it. The riverboat is the spell’s sensor and only moves on water, but you can otherwise move it as normal for the spell.

Haunting Curse. When a creature leaves the riverboat, it must make a DC 0 Charisma saving throw, becoming cursed on a failed save. While cursed in this way, it has Disadvantage on Wisdom and Charisma ability checks and on saving throws to avoid or end the Frightened condition. After you make this saving throw, the save DC increases by 2. This increase can’t happen again until you finish a Long Rest.

jrT5pWIDCwVJrwBh.name: Revelry Suit jrT5pWIDCwVJrwBh
jrT5pWIDCwVJrwBh.description:
Armor (hide), rare (requires attunement)

This bulky suit is made from natural materials, including fur, canvas, and straw. Its mask is exceptionally oversized and shaped into a sun, smiling in an unsettling way. While you wear this armor, you gain a +2 bonus to AC, and it grants the following properties.

Dancing Dodge. When you fail a Dexterity saving throw, if your speed isn’t 0, you can use this property to succeed instead. Once used, this property can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Wild Steps. As a bonus action, you can move up to your speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

Dancing Curse. When you roll initiative, you must make a DC 0 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you become incapacitated, and your speed is 0 until the start of your next turn as you perform a folk dance. When you use the Dancing Dodge or Wild Steps properties, the DC of the saving throw increases by 2. The DC of this curse can’t increase again until you finish a long rest.

Wytchwood Sap.name: Wytchwood Sap
Wytchwood Sap.description:
Potion, rare

As a bonus action, you can coat one weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition with this sticky sap and choose a damage type: &reference[acid apply=false], &reference[cold apply=false], &reference[fire apply=false], &reference[lightning apply=false], &reference[poison apply=false], or &reference[thunder apply=false]. A creature that takes damage from the coated weapon or ammunition takes an extra [[/damage 3d8]] damage of the chosen type. Once applied, the sap retains its potency for 1 minute or until its damage is dealt, whichever comes first.

Wytchwood Sap is stored in small vessels made of bark with a wooden stopper that never fully contains this oozing, amber-hued tar.

Heightened Potency. If you roll the same number on two or more of the d8s, another creature of your choice within 30 feet of your target takes [[/damage 2d8]] damage of the same type.

kltRcoX1BAwzdtRA.name: Shield of Marius Renathyr kltRcoX1BAwzdtRA
kltRcoX1BAwzdtRA.description:
Armor (shield), rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

Crafted from polished gold and white enamel and adorned with an intricate design of a rose encircled by thorny vines, this shield was once owned by Marius Renathyr, a knight-errant destined for a terrible fate.

While holding this shield, you gain a bonus to AC determined by the shield’s rarity, in addition to the shield’s normal bonus to AC, and you can use the following properties.

Valorous Guard (Rare+). When a creature within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to add 2 + the shield’s bonus to the creature’s AC, potentially causing the attack to miss. When a creature within 5 feet of you fails a Dexterity saving throw, you can use your reaction to add 2 + the shield’s bonus to the creature’s total, potentially causing it to succeed.

Honor of the Vanguard (Very Rare+). When you roll initiative and an ally you can see is within 30 feet of an enemy, you can teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of that ally and gain temporary hit points equal to 5 times the shield’s bonus.

Righteous Wrath (Very Rare+). When you use the Valorous Guard property to cause an attack to miss, the next time you hit that attacker with a weapon or unarmed strike before the end of your next turn, it takes an extra [[/damage 1d8]] (legendary: [[/damage 3d8]]) radiant damage.

As Terrible as the Dawn (Legendary). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.5e1xTohkzqFqbYH4]{Flame Strike} (save DC 19) from the shield. If you are in the spell’s area, you regain [[/damage 5d6 healing]]{5d6 hit point} instead of taking damage. Once the spell is cast from the shield, it can’t be cast from it again until the next dusk.

As Terrible as the Dawn (Legendary) Heal.name: As Terrible as the Dawn (Legendary) Heal

lXPgrniGnUeqih2n.name: Draught of the Red Hunger lXPgrniGnUeqih2n
lXPgrniGnUeqih2n.description:
Potion, Legendary

When you drink this potion, you gain a ravenous thirst for blood and gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.UfHQhA54M4323gVO]{Vampiric Touch} spell (level 6 version, no Concentration required) for 1 minute. You can repeat the attack on subsequent turns as a Bonus Action instead of a Magic action.

This liquid is a shimmering red deeper and more intense than natural blood.

Heightened Potency. For the duration, as a Magic action, you can gain the effects of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.2IWiZAJtOGDoKjiz]{Gaseous Form} spell (no Concentration required) while you aren’t in sunlight. You can also revert to your normal form as a Magic action.

lft8x0pFwjJTx8UL.name: Scythe of the Harvest Terror lft8x0pFwjJTx8UL
lft8x0pFwjJTx8UL.description:
Weapon (Halberd), Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

This menacing scythe with a rusted blade was wielded by the Harvest Terror, a demon of secrets and fear. The scythe appears old and worn, with a handle wrapped in ancient, weathered cloth. The blade is etched with hatch marks, tallying its kills.

You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with this magic weapon determined by its rarity. While holding the scythe, you can use the following properties.

Feed on Fear (Rare+). Once during your turn, when you attack with the scythe and hit a creature that has the &reference[Frightened apply=false] condition, it takes an extra [[/r 1d10]] (Legendary: [[/r 2d10]]) Psychic damage.

Sweep of Dread (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XXUDGFELgoskdOD0]{Fear} (save DC = 16 + the scythe’s bonus, no Concentration required) from the scythe. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Harvest of the Hidden Word (Very Rare+). As a Bonus Action, you can force one creature you can see that has the &reference[Frightened apply=false] condition to make a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the scythe’s bonus). On a failed save, you learn one fact that it deliberately keeps secret. The creature is then immune to this property for 24 hours.

Seed of Terror (Very Rare+). Immediately after you hit a creature with the scythe, you can take a Bonus Action to force one creature within 30 feet of the creature you hit to make a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the Scythe’s bonus). On a failed save, the creature gains the &reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the end of your next turn.

Lurking Terror (Legendary). When a creature you can see that has the Frightened condition ends its turn within 60 feet of you, you can take a Reaction to teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space the Frightened creature can see.

Harvest of the Hidden Word (Very Rare+).name: Harvest of the Hidden Word (Very Rare+)

Idol of the Beast of Blight.name: Idol of the Beast of Blight
Idol of the Beast of Blight.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

Made of bleached and mutated bone, this idol in the shape of a stag contains the sinister knowledge of the Beast of Blight. It pulses with the power of rot and decay.

While holding the idol, you can use it as a Spellcasting Focus for your spells, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the idol’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Rotting Touch (Rare+). You can use your Strength, Dexterity, or Wisdom modifier for the attack and damage rolls of your Unarmed Strikes, and on a hit, your strike deals an extra [[/damage 1d6 Necrotic]] damage (Rare), [[/damage 1d8 Necrotic]] damage (Very Rare), or [[/damage 1d10 Necrotic]] damage (Legendary).

Touch of Oblivion (Rare+). As a Bonus Action, you can touch a creature that has been dead for less than 1 hour. It rots away to bleached bone and can’t be used for this property again. The next time you hit with an Unarmed Strike using the Rotting Touch property before the end of your next turn, it is a Critical Hit instead.

Hallucinatory Spores (Very Rare+). When you cast a spell using a spell slot or from the idol, you can choose one creature that you can see within 10 feet of you. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the idol’s bonus) or take 2d6 Psychic damage and have Disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

Rot in the Flesh (Very Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.JPwIEfgUPVebr5AH]{Barkskin} from the idol targeting only yourself. For the duration, a creature that hits you with a melee attack roll takes [[/damage 1d8 Necrotic]] damage. Once the spell is cast from the idol, it can’t be cast from it again until the next dusk.

Hollow with Rot (Legendary). When you regain Hit Points from a spell, you also gain Temporary Hit Points equal to the spell’s level.

Idol of the Beast of Blight +2.name: Idol of the Beast of Blight +2

Idol of the Beast of Blight +3.name: Idol of the Beast of Blight +3

Rot in the Flesh (Very Rare+) Damage.name: Rot in the Flesh (Very Rare+) Damage

Idol of the Beast of Blight +3.name: Idol of the Beast of Blight +3

Idol of the Beast of Blight +2.name: Idol of the Beast of Blight +2

Idol of the Beast of Blight +1.name: Idol of the Beast of Blight +1

Touch of Oblivion (Rare+).name: Touch of Oblivion (Rare+)
Touch of Oblivion (Rare+).description: As a bonus action, you can touch a creature that has been dead for less than 1 hour. It rots away to bleached bone and can’t be used for this property again. The next time you hit with an unarmed strike using the Rotting Touch property before the end of your next turn, it is a critical hit instead.

mE1Nm9ZCokBe2nGe.name: Withered Hand mE1Nm9ZCokBe2nGe
mE1Nm9ZCokBe2nGe.description:
Wondrous item, rare (requires attunement)

The skin of this desiccated hand on a looped leather cord is covered with tattoos signifying dreadful hexes. The fingers seem to curl slightly when the hand is at the edge of your vision. While you hold or wear the hand, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs. The hand grants the following properties.

Withering Grasp. When you make an unarmed strike, you can extend your reach to 30 feet with threads of magenta jinx magic. When you do so, on a hit, you deal necrotic damage instead of bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a creature no more than one size larger than you, you grapple it with the threads. The escape DC for this grapple can use your spellcasting ability or Charisma (your choice) in place of your Strength. The grapple ends if you use this property against a different target.

Withering Curse. When you use the Withering Grasp property, your hit point maximum decreases by 1. Your hit point maximum can’t decrease again until you finish a long rest.

mE5M41crpypSN6vm.name: Visage of the Old Ways mE5M41crpypSN6vm
mE5M41crpypSN6vm.description:
Wondrous item, rare (+2), very rare (+4), legendary (+6) (requires attunement)

This wood-carved mask has a haunted expression and makes the wearer’s eyes look like empty shadows. Rabbit ears protrude over the head. While you wear the mask, you hear the whispers of an ancient forest archfey deep within your mind.

While wearing the mask, you gain a bonus to your damage rolls when you deal fire damage determined by the mask’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Cultic Mask (Rare+). You can’t be targeted by divination spells or perceived through scrying sensors. Ability checks made to discern your identity have a minimum DC of 25.

Fire Within (Rare+). You can take a bonus action to begin or stop burning. While you are burning in this way, your weapon attacks deal an extra [[/damage 2d4 fire]] damage, and you take [[/damage 1d4 fire]] damage at the start of each of your turns.

Strange Sight (Rare+). You have darkvision with a range of 60 feet, and you can see normally through areas obscured by smoke.

Mastery of Flame (Very Rare+). Fire damage you deal ignores resistance.

Sacrificial Flame (Very Rare+). As a bonus action, you can cause a creature you can see with 0 hit points that is within 30 feet of you to burst into flame. Its body burns to ash over the next minute, and when a creature hostile to you starts its turn within 10 feet of the body, it takes [[/damage 2d8 fire]] damage. The flame is extinguished if the target regains any hit points.

Harvest Offering (Legendary). As an action, you can expend up to 5 Hit Dice to regain a spell slot of a level equal to the number of Hit Dice spent. Alternatively, you can touch a creature that is willing or is unconscious and force them to expend any number of these Hit Dice in your place. This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

Blunderbuss of the Grinning Sinner.name: Blunderbuss of the Grinning Sinner
Blunderbuss of the Grinning Sinner.description:
Weapon (musket), rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This dark, ornate blunderbuss has a brass barrel and a wooden handle etched with arcane symbols. It was the Grinning Sinner’s weapon of choice, who imbued it with the power to shoot jinxes and hexes.

The blunderbuss functions as a musket: a martial ranged weapon with a normal range of 40 feet and a long range of 120 feet, and it has the ammunition (bullet) and two-handed properties. It can make its own ammunition that deals necrotic damage on a hit. You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it determined by the its rarity. While holding the blunderbuss, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your spells, and you can use the following properties.

Jinxshot (Rare+). When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a blast from the blunderbuss that forces each creature within a 30-foot cone to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 16 + the blunderbuss’s bonus), taking [[/damage 2d4 necrotic]] damage (Rare) or [[/damage 3d6 necrotic]] damage (Very Rare+) on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Sinner’s Jinx (Very Rare+). Once during your turn when you damage a creature with the blunderbuss, the target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the blunderbuss’s bonus) or be cursed for 1 minute. When it makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw while cursed, it subtracts [[/r 1d4]] from the total. The curse ends if this property is used on another creature.

Luck Taker (Legendary). When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you that is cursed by this weapon makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw and rolls a 19 or 20 on the d20, you can use your reaction to mimic their luck. The next time you roll a d20 within 1 minute, change the number you roll to the triggering number.

Sinner’s Jinx (Very Rare+).name: Sinner’s Jinx (Very Rare+)
Sinner’s Jinx (Very Rare+).description: When it makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw while cursed, it subtracts 1d4 from the total.

Luck Taker (Legendary).name: Luck Taker (Legendary)
Luck Taker (Legendary).description: When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you that is cursed by this weapon makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw and rolls a 19 or 20 on the d20, you can use your reaction to mimic their luck. The next time you roll a d20 within 1 minute, change the number you roll to the triggering numbe

nun45MIODBEA5bUH.name: Haint Hooch nun45MIODBEA5bUH
nun45MIODBEA5bUH.description:
Potion, rare

When you drink from this glass jug, you become insubstantial for 1 minute. During this time, you can move through creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain, taking [[/damage 1d10 force]] damage if you end your turn inside an object.

The potion is stored in jugs labeled “XxX,” with a skeletal smile drawn on it. The ghastly, blue-green liquor within has an overpowering smell and harsh taste.

Heightened Potency. For the duration, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

oqjEnz5tNOr6Tjsd.name: Sword of the Crimson Abbot oqjEnz5tNOr6Tjsd
oqjEnz5tNOr6Tjsd.description:
Weapon (longsword), rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This powerful, fiendish sword was once wielded by the Crimson Abbot. While it was created as a gift that brought evil and malice to the corrupted former knight, it has lost its connections to the Crimson Rose. However, its evil origins still linger within. The sword is sleek and polished, with a blade that absorbs light. A blood-red ruby on the hilt is fitted within a setting of thorns and roses.

You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls with this magic weapon determined by the sword’s rarity. While holding the sword, you can use the following properties.

Blood Drain (Rare+). When you hit a creature with the sword, it takes an extra [[/damage 1d6 necrotic]] damage.

Irresistible Hunger (Very Rare+). Necrotic damage you deal ignores resistance.

Vampiric Charm (Very Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.eS7XnnApoxRxYXPs]{Charm Person} (save DC = 16 + the sword’s bonus, no concentration required) from the sword. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Embrace of the Duchess (Legendary). As an action, you can touch the sword to the body of a Humanoid that has been dead for 1 minute or less. The creature must succeed on a [[/save CHA DC 19]] saving throw (as if it were alive) or become a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.zpaZb7I8alY32vWV]{Vampire Spawn} that dies again at dawn. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Stolen Life (Legendary). When you deal necrotic damage with the Blood Drain property, you can expend and roll one Hit Die. You regain hit points equal to the number rolled plus the necrotic damage dealt.

pKAMlxe2mbMClXw5.name: Runestone of the Wild Titan pKAMlxe2mbMClXw5
pKAMlxe2mbMClXw5.description:
Wondrous item, rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This mighty granite runestone is etched with complex glyphs on much of its angular surface. Though an incredible burden to carry, it thrums with the power of the wild titan. The stone weighs 50 pounds.

While holding the stone, you gain a bonus to Strength and Constitution saving throws determined by the runestone’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Crushing Weight (Rare+). When you are within 5 feet of a &reference[prone apply=false] creature, you can take a bonus action to set the stone on the creature, which becomes &reference[restrained apply=false] by the stone. The creature can take an action to make a Strength saving throw (DC = 16 + the stone’s bonus), pushing the stone free and ending the restrained condition on a success.

Boulder Throw (Very Rare+). You can throw the stone as a simple ranged weapon using Strength for the attack and damage rolls. The stone has the heavy and thrown properties. It has a normal range equal to twice your Strength score and a long range equal to five times your Strength score. On a hit, it deals [[/damage 2d10 bludgeoning]] damage, and the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC = 16 + the stone’s bonus) or be knocked prone.

Recall (Very Rare+). As a bonus action, you can call the stone back to you, provided it is within 1 mile. If you have an empty hand, it appears in your hand; otherwise, it appears at your feet in your space.

Primal Vitality (Legendary). While you stand on fertile soil or unworked stone, you have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws, and you gain temporary hit points equal to [[/damage 2d6]] + your Strength modifier at the start of each of your turns.

Pummeling Boulder (Legendary). The damage of the Boulder Throw property increases to [[/damage 3d10]], and the stone deals double damage to objects and structures.

pRwxN131RskdKA0Y.name: Whistle of the Vagrant pRwxN131RskdKA0Y
pRwxN131RskdKA0Y.description:
Wondrous item, rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This tarnished brass whistle belonged to the conductor of the Ghostlight Express, imbuing it with ghastly, mysterious powers. Its metal is cold to the touch, and its sound is an unnerving shriek.

While you hold or wear the whistle, you gain a bonus determined by the whistle’s rarity to all saving throws, and you can use the following properties.

Call the Dead (Rare+). As an action, you can blow the whistle to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.n4JDcFKe5ikzYmAc]{Gentle Repose} on all dead bodies within 30 feet of you. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Sense the Undead (Rare+). As a bonus action, you can detect the presence and location of Undead within 60 feet of you, even through total cover of any material other than iron or lead.

Undaunted (Rare+). You have advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the &reference[frightened apply=false] condition.

Call the Undead (Very Rare+). As an action, you can blow the whistle to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pxpb2eOB6bv4phAf]{Banishment} against an Undead creature (save DC = 16 + the whistle’s bonus) from it. The target always appears in a harmless demiplane resembling the interior of a train. If you maintain the spell for its full duration, the target arrives in an appropriate afterlife. Creatures with legendary actions automatically succeed on the saving throw. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Steam Cloud (Very Rare+). You can blow the whistle to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.IBJmWjzbQGu7M4UX]{Fog Cloud} (no concentration required) from it. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Touched by Death (Very Rare+). You have resistance to &reference[necrotic apply=false] damage.

Afterlife Express (Legendary). You can blow the whistle to cast @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.KfMuCODOEewASaPL]{Ghastly Charge}* (takes the form of a ghost train) from it. This property can be used twice, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

Mask of Lethica Nightborne.name: Mask of Lethica Nightborne
Mask of Lethica Nightborne.description:
Wondrous item, rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This immaculate porcelain mask is painted with delicate violet filigree and once belonged to Lethica Nightborne—a priestess of a goddess of night and healing known as the Nightmother.

While wearing the mask, you gain a bonus to Wisdom and Charisma saving throws determined by the mask’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Gift of the Night Goddess (Rare+). You can see normally in magical and nonmagical dim light and darkness.

Soothing Darkness (Rare+). Creatures of your choice in the area of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.S7VbUetIfVT7B6Eq]{Darkness} spell that you cast have resistance to &reference[psychic apply=false] damage.

Whispers of Night (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.S7VbUetIfVT7B6Eq]{Darkness} from the mask. This property can be used twice (very rare+: four times), regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

Balm of Midnight (Very Rare+). At the start of your turn, a frightened creature of your choice within 60 feet of you must make a [[/save WIS DC 15]] saving throw. On a success, the condition ends, and if the creature is in an area of darkness, it gains [[/damage 2d10 temp]].

Offering of Burdens (Legendary). As an action, you can touch a willing creature with levels of exhaustion and transfer any number of &reference[exhaustion apply=false] levels to yourself, then remove up to two exhaustion levels from yourself and regain one expended spell slot of 5th level or lower. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Surcease of Sorrows (Legendary). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.r3243JU4AyQJyfX4]{Modify Memory} from the mask (save DC 19). If the target voluntarily fails the saving throw, you can choose a memory that happened at any time in its lifespan. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Soothing Darkness (Rare+).name: Soothing Darkness (Rare+)
Soothing Darkness (Rare+).description: Creatures of your choice in the area of a Darkness spell that you cast have resistance to Psychic damage.

Silence of the Drowned.name: Silence of the Drowned
Silence of the Drowned.description:
Potion, uncommon

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.5VhqFROQYjr1P9lp]{Silence} spell (no concentration required) as a 20-foot sphere centered on you for 10 minutes, and for the duration, squid tentacles emerge from your mouth.

This sculpted clay jar is painted in a deep blue and adorned with squid tentacles. Uncorking it reduces all noise in the area as if you are underwater, and the liquid within is a coppery blue-green.

Heightened Potency. For the duration, you can spit ink from your mouth as a bonus action. One creature within 30 feet of you makes a [[/save DEX DC 13]] saving throw. On a failed save, the target is &reference[blinded apply=false] until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target is immune to this property for the next 24 hours.

sDsDp82mGHeOhMnJ.name: Jinxed Poker Chip sDsDp82mGHeOhMnJ
sDsDp82mGHeOhMnJ.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

This ceramic poker chip is painted with a crocodile’s skull on one side. Hoarse laughter sounds when it flips. While you hold the chip, it grants the following properties.

Jinxed Luck. When you fail a D20 Test, you can take a Reaction to flip the chip. Roll [[/r 1d6]]. On a 4–6, you succeed on the D20 Test instead. After you use this property, roll 1d20. On a 1–5, this property can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Sense Cheating. If you have proficiency with a Gaming Set, you automatically succeed on ability checks to know if someone in a game you are playing is cheating.

Cursed Coin. When you roll Initiative, you must succeed on a DC 0 Charisma saving throw or become cursed until you finish a Short or Long Rest. While cursed, you subtract [[/r 1d6]] from D20 Tests. When you use the Jinxed Luck property, the saving throw DC increases by 1.

sZvX99kRvdvtZt1C.name: Blunderbuss of the Grinning Sinner sZvX99kRvdvtZt1C
sZvX99kRvdvtZt1C.description:
Weapon (Musket), Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

This dark, ornate blunderbuss has a brass barrel and a wooden handle etched with arcane symbols. It was the Grinning Sinner’s weapon of choice, who imbued it with the power to shoot jinxes and hexes.

The blunderbuss functions as a Musket that ignores the Loading property, and it can make its own ammunition that deals Necrotic damage on a hit. You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it determined by the blunderbuss’s rarity. While holding the blunderbuss, you can use the blunderbuss as a Spellcasting Focus for your spells, and you can use the following properties.

Jinxshot (Rare+). When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with a blast from the blunderbuss that forces each creature within a 30-foot Cone to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 16 + the blunderbuss’s bonus), taking [[/damage 2d4 Necrotic]] damage (Rare) or [[/damage 3d6 Necrotic]] damage (Very Rare+) on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Sinner’s Jinx (Very Rare+). Once during your turn when you damage a creature with the blunderbuss, the target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw (DC = 16 + the blunderbuss’s bonus) or be cursed for 1 minute. When it makes a D20 Test while cursed, it subtracts [[/r 1d4]] from the total. The curse ends if this property is used on another creature.

Luck Taker (Legendary). When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you that is cursed by this weapon makes a D20 Test and rolls a 19 or 20 on the d20, you can take a Reaction to mimic their luck. The next time you make a D20 Test within 1 minute, change the number you roll on the d20 to the triggering number.

Sinner’s Jinx (Very Rare+).name: Sinner’s Jinx (Very Rare+)
Sinner’s Jinx (Very Rare+).description: When it makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw while cursed, it subtracts 1d4 from the total.

Luck Taker (Legendary).name: Luck Taker (Legendary)
Luck Taker (Legendary).description: When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you that is cursed by this weapon makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw and rolls a 19 or 20 on the d20, you can use your reaction to mimic their luck. The next time you roll a d20 within 1 minute, change the number you roll to the triggering numbe

tx4xo2ObLUKRSGet.name: Cane of Phillip Druskenvald tx4xo2ObLUKRSGet
tx4xo2ObLUKRSGet.description:
Rod, rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

This ornate cane is made from polished black wood and is topped with a silver goat-skull ornament. Even a glance at it sparks greed and envy in all but the truly humble.

While holding the cane, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your spells, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the cane’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Eldritch Glutton (Rare+). When you succeed on a saving throw against a spell that targets only you, you can use your reaction to consume the spell and store its energy in the cane. The spell has no effect on you. You can take an action to absorb the stored energy to either regain an expended spell slot that is at least one level lower than the triggering spell or gain temporary hit points equal to three times the spell’s level. If you absorb a new spell while the cane holds spell energy, the previous energy is lost. Once the cane absorbs a spell, this property can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Allure of Sin (Very Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.91Sw6vOIaO7U8DvM]{Dominate Person} (save DC = 16 + the cane’s bonus) from the cane. Once a creature is charmed by the spell, this property can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Sin-Binder’s Call (Legendary). As an action, you can summon three @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.iSCL4Q82ivnYelzc]{Hell Hounds}, one @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.VmdyZDjqAc8vdncY]{Incubus}, or one @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.VmdyZDjqAc8vdncY]{Succubus}. They appear in unoccupied spaces you can see within 30 feet of you, obey your commands, and take their turns immediately after yours on your initiative count. After 10 minutes, they no longer obey you, but if you treated them well, they are indifferent or friendly toward you. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

ujGIceMIXo877Yk1.name: Silence of the Drowned ujGIceMIXo877Yk1
ujGIceMIXo877Yk1.description:
Potion, Uncommon

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.5VhqFROQYjr1P9lp]{Silence} spell (no Concentration required) as a 20-foot Emanation originating from you for 10 minutes, and for the duration, squid tentacles emerge from your mouth.

This sculpted clay jar is painted in a deep blue and adorned with squid tentacles. Uncorking it reduces all noise in the area as if you are underwater, and the liquid within is a coppery blue-green.

Heightened Potency. For the duration, you can spit ink from your mouth as a Bonus Action. One creature within 30 feet of you makes a [[/save DEX DC 13]] saving throw. On a failed save, the target gains the &reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the start of your next turn. On a successful save, the target is immune to this property for the next 24 hours.

v1S3ZnuRy5vJT0a0.name: Cutlass of Briggsy Kratch v1S3ZnuRy5vJT0a0
v1S3ZnuRy5vJT0a0.description:
Weapon (scimitar), rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

A fearsome weapon imbued with jinxcraft magic, this cutlass was once wielded by the notorious pirate captain, Briggsy “The Kutlass” Kratch. Its tarnished blade glimmers with a faint, otherworldly light. A skull and crossbones adorn the leather-wrapped hilt, and arcane symbols etched into the blade pulse with hidden power.

You gain a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with the cutlass determined by its rarity. While holding the cutlass, you can use the following properties.

Raise the Stakes (Rare+). As a bonus action, choose a creature within 5 feet of you and mark it until the start of your next turn. Count the number of times you hit the target and the number of times it hits you while the mark lasts. If you hit the target more times, it takes [[/damage 2d10 psychic]] damage. If it hits you more times, you take [[/damage 2d10 psychic]] damage. If your hits are tied, you both take [[/damage 2d10 psychic]] damage. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Sea Legs (Rare+). When you take the &reference[Disengage apply=false] action, difficult terrain doesn’t cost you extra movement until the end of that turn.

Double Down (Very Rare+). When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can make one additional attack against a target marked by the Raise the Stakes property.

Jinxcraft Panache (Very Rare+). When a creature hits you with an attack roll, you can use your reaction to increase your AC against that attack by twice the cutlass’s bonus to attack and damage rolls if the creature already dealt damage to you on this turn.

Hex Ward (Legendary). You can’t be targeted with divination spells or perceived through magical scrying sensors, and a creature that curses you takes psychic damage equal to your level.

w3rcMRl6qmsyQANa.name: Wytchwood Sap w3rcMRl6qmsyQANa
w3rcMRl6qmsyQANa.description:
Potion, Rare

As a Bonus Action, you can coat one weapon or up to three pieces of ammunition with this sticky sap and choose a damage type: &reference[Acid apply=false], &reference[Cold apply=false], &reference[Fire apply=false], &reference[lightning apply=false], &reference[Poison apply=false], or &reference[Thunder apply=false]. A creature that takes damage from the coated weapon or ammunition takes an extra [[/damage 3d8 damage]] of the chosen type. Once applied, the sap retains its potency for 1 minute or until its damage is dealt, whichever comes first.

Wytchwood Sap is stored in small vessels made of bark with a wooden stopper that never fully contains this oozing, amber-hued tar.

Heightened Potency. If you roll the same number on two or more of the d8s, another creature of your choice within 30 feet of your target takes [[/damage 2d8 damage]] of the same type.

xbrZG9oNY8aXv54H.name: Crown of the Barrow King xbrZG9oNY8aXv54H
xbrZG9oNY8aXv54H.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

This crown of twisted iron has five sharp, tall spikes that are crusted with dried blood. None who see it doubt the malice and corruption that the Barrow King imbued into it.

While you wear the crown, you gain a bonus determined by the crown’s rarity to spell attack rolls and to your spell save DC for Necromancy spells and spells that deal Necrotic damage, and you can use the following properties.

Demand of the Dead (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.I2LUSF5ogc7Bj62e]{Speak with Dead} from the crown.

Grave Grasp (Rare+). You know the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.vrN18tbTw7io5MWd]{Chill Touch} cantrip. Your spell attack bonus with it is +9 (Rare), +10 (Very Rare), or +11 (Legendary).

Necromancer’s Call (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.oyE5nVppa5mde5gT]{Animate Dead} from the crown. It can be used to cast this spell three times, regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

Master of Undeath (Very Rare+). Undead that you create or summon have twice as many Hit Points as normal and have Advantage on saving throws.

Soul Transfer (Very Rare+). When you drop to 0 Hit Points or fail a Death Saving Throw, you can transfer your soul into an Undead that you created and that is within 1 mile of you (no action required). Your previous body dies instantly. Your new body has none of your possessions except the crown. You use your game statistics, except the target Undead’s current Hit Points replace your current Hit Points. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Compel Undead (Legendary). As a Magic action, you can choose an Undead within 30 feet of you. It must succeed on a [[/save WIS DC 19]] saving throw or have the &reference[Charmed apply=false] condition for 1 minute. It obeys your commands while Charmed in this way, and the condition ends early when the creature is Bloodied.

xuoAXg0qmoyDCQaw.name: Idol of the Beast of Blight xuoAXg0qmoyDCQaw
xuoAXg0qmoyDCQaw.description:
Wondrous item, rare (+1), very rare (+2), legendary (+3) (requires attunement)

Made of bleached and mutated bone, this idol in the shape of a stag contains the sinister knowledge of the Beast of Blight. It pulses with the power of rot and decay.

While holding the idol, you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your spells, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC determined by the idol’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Rotting Touch (Rare+). You can use your Strength, Dexterity, or Wisdom modifier for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes, and on a hit, your strike deals an extra [[/damage 1d6 necrotic]] damage (rare), [[/damage 1d8 necrotic]] damage (very rare), or [[/damage 1d10 necrotic]] damage (legendary).

Touch of Oblivion (Rare+). As a bonus action, you can touch a creature that has been dead for less than 1 hour. It rots away to bleached bone and can’t be used for this property again. The next time you hit with an unarmed strike using the Rotting Touch property before the end of your next turn, it is a critical hit instead.

Hallucinatory Spores (Very Rare+). When you cast a spell using a spell slot or from the idol, you can choose one creature that you can see within 10 feet of you. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC = 16 + the idol’s bonus) or take [[/damage 2d6 psychic]] damage and have disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

Rot in the Flesh (Very Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.JPwIEfgUPVebr5AH]{Barkskin} from the idol targeting only yourself. For the duration, a creature that hits you with a melee attack roll takes [[/damage 1d8 necrotic]] damage. Once the spell is cast from the idol, it can’t be cast from it again until the next dusk.

Hollow with Rot (Legendary). When you regain hit points from a spell, you also gain temporary hit points equal to the spell’s level.

Touch of Oblivion (Rare+).name: Touch of Oblivion (Rare+)
Touch of Oblivion (Rare+).description: As a bonus action, you can touch a creature that has been dead for less than 1 hour. It rots away to bleached bone and can’t be used for this property again. The next time you hit with an unarmed strike using the Rotting Touch property before the end of your next turn, it is a critical hit instead.

y4r4yyLnG2fEwZGy.name: Mask of Lethica Nightborne y4r4yyLnG2fEwZGy
y4r4yyLnG2fEwZGy.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), Legendary (+3) (Requires Attunement)

This immaculate porcelain mask is painted with delicate violet filigree and once belonged to Lethica Nightborne—a priestess of a goddess of night and healing known as the Nightmother.

While wearing the mask, you gain a bonus to Wisdom and Charisma saving throws determined by the mask’s rarity, and you can use the following properties.

Gift of the Night Goddess (Rare+). You can see normally in magical and nonmagical Dim Light and Darkness.

Soothing Darkness (Rare+). Creatures of your choice in the area of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.S7VbUetIfVT7B6Eq]{Darkness} spell that you cast have Resistance to Psychic damage.

Whispers of Night (Rare+). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.S7VbUetIfVT7B6Eq]{Darkness} from the mask. This property can be used twice (Very Rare+: four times), regaining all expended uses daily at dusk.

Balm of Midnight (Very Rare+). At the start of your turn, a Frightened creature of your choice within 60 feet of you must make a [[/save WIS DC 15]] saving throw. On a success, the condition ends, and if the creature is in an area of Darkness, it gains [[/damage 2d10 temp]].

Offering of Burdens (Legendary). As a Magic action, you can touch a willing creature with &reference[Exhaustion apply=false] levels and transfer any number of Exhaustion levels to yourself, then remove up to two Exhaustion levels from yourself and regain one expended spell slot of level 5 or lower. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Surcease of Sorrows (Legendary). You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.r3243JU4AyQJyfX4]{Modify Memory} from the mask (save DC 19). If the target voluntarily fails the saving throw, you can choose a memory that happened at any time in its lifespan. Once this property is used, it can’t be used again until the next dusk.

Soothing Darkness (Rare+).name: Soothing Darkness (Rare+)
Soothing Darkness (Rare+).description: Creatures of your choice in the area of a Darkness spell that you cast have resistance to Psychic damage.

yoxPUtasaqHQgPV8.name: Lilypad Tonic yoxPUtasaqHQgPV8
yoxPUtasaqHQgPV8.description:
Potion, Common

When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.04nMsTWkIFvkbXlY]{Polymorph} spell (no Concentration required), turning you into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.EZgiprHXA2D7Uyb3]{Frog}.

This potion is found in a clay jar shaped and painted like a large frog, with a cork stopper in its back.

Heightened Potency. The potion has six doses instead of one.

zhJuQ6LwVCDILePE.name: Amber Birdcage zhJuQ6LwVCDILePE
zhJuQ6LwVCDILePE.description:
Wondrous Item, Very Rare (Requires Attunement)

This birdcage, shaped from amber, physically replaces your torso while you are attuned to it. When your Attunement ends, it separates from you, and your torso returns to its previous state. The birdcage has the following properties.

Sense Fiends. As a Bonus Action, you can sense the location of Fiends or magical effects created by Fiends within 60 feet of yourself.

Capture Fiend. As a Magic action, choose one Bloodied Fiend that you can see within 60 feet of yourself. It must succeed on a [[/save CHA DC 15]] saving throw or be transformed into an amber songbird and trapped in the birdcage. The songbird is an inert object until removed from the cage and released. You can remove one songbird from the cage as a Bonus Action. If you stop holding the bird, the Fiend reverts to its true form with all its Hit Points, and it is Hostile to you.

Consume Songbird. As a Magic action, you can consume one amber songbird you are holding. The Fiend dies, and you can either regain one expended spell slot with a level up to half the Fiend’s CR, or you can gain Temporary Hit Points equal to the Fiend’s CR.

Amber Curse. You have a −1 penalty to Wisdom saving throws. Each time you use the Capture Fiend or Consume Songbird properties, this penalty increases by 1.

zhOwUYwxjOA5BdsP.name: Midwife Shears zhOwUYwxjOA5BdsP
zhOwUYwxjOA5BdsP.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

These scissors are shaped to resemble a stork. Their blades are forever wickedly sharp, and the threads they cut are more than merely physical.

Cut the Unseen Thread. While holding the scissors, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.15Fa6q1nH27XfbR8]{Dispel Magic} (+4 bonus) or Remove Curse from them. Once either spell is cast from the scissors, that spell can’t be cast from them again until the next dusk.

Curse of the Severed Thread. When you make a saving throw to avoid being pushed or to avoid the &reference[Prone apply=false] condition, you have a −1 penalty to the roll. This penalty increases by 1 each time you use the Cut the Unseen Thread property. If you fail such a save by 5 or more, you are pushed 1d6 x 5 feet straight away from the source of the save, in addition to any other distance pushed.

Cut the Unseen Thread - Dispel Magic.name: Cut the Unseen Thread - Dispel Magic

Cut the Unseen Thread - Remove Curse.name: Cut the Unseen Thread - Remove Curse
